intro: Henriettea mucronata, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, leathery leaves and showy blooms make it a popular ornamental plant. Henriettea mucronata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
